tit.cmt: 姓のよみは「なかしま」となっているので、訂正しました。

sen.j: 中島 正時（なかしま まさとき、? - 慶長16年12月20日 (旧暦)（1612年1月22日））は安土桃山時代の武士、通称・四郎左衛門、父は中島正義。
sen.e: Masatoki NAKAJIMA (birth date unknown - January 22, 1612) was a warrior during the Azuchi-Momoyama period, went by the name of Shirozaemon and a son of Masayoshi NAKAJIMA.
Masatoki NAKASHIMA (year of birth unknown - January 22, 1612) was a warrior during the Azuchi-Momoyama period, went by the name of Shirozaemon and a son of Masayoshi NAKASHIMA.

sen.e: The Nakajima clan claimed they had descended from Mitsuyuki YAMANA.

sen.j: 中島家に伝わる伝記によれば、山名満幸の子・三重郎幸康（嘉吉元年（1441年）3月没）なる人物を初めとしている。
sen.e: According to a biography handed down through the Nakajima family, the family was founded by Sanjuro Yukiyasu (died in April 1441), a son of Mitsuyuki YAMANA.

sen.j: 幸康から数代後の当主・与七郎正義の代に巨濃郡陸上（現・岩美町）に移ったという。
sen.e: It is said that the family moved to Kugami, Kono no Kori (present Iwamicho) by the head of the family Yoshichiro Masaoshi, several generations after Yukiyasu.

sen.j: 実際には地侍級の小在地領主から成長したものと思われる。
sen.e: It is supposed that the family was descended from a local proprietor of a land, acting as a local military leader.

sen.j: 父の与七郎正義の代には陸上の中島城 (因幡国)に居城し、永禄年間に武田高信と守護・山名氏の間で起こった内乱に乗じて勢力を拡大したという。
sen.e: It is said that the family lived in Nakajima-jo Castle in Kugami in Inaba Province in the days of his father Yoshichiro Masayoshi, and expanded influence by taking advantage of a conflict started between Takanobu TAKEDA and the Yamana clan, a military governor, in the eiroku era.

sen.j: 続いて正時が家督を継いだ際に山名から中島姓へと改め、道竹城主・山名豊弘の幕下となった。
sen.e: When Masatoki succeeded his father, he changed the family name from Yamana to Nakajima and became a vassal of Toyohiro YAMANA, the lord of Dochiku-jo Castle.
When Masatoki succeeded his father, he changed the family name from Yamana to Nakashima and became a vassal of Toyohiro YAMANA, the lord of Dochiku-jo Castle.

sen.j: 天正8年（1580年）11月には豊弘から入国以来の忠勤を賞され、巨濃郡陸上・宇治・大野の三ヵ所が与えられたが、翌年の豊臣秀吉による鳥取城攻略後、所領を失い流浪の身となり、慶長16年（1611年）12月に没した。
sen.e: In December 1580, Masatoki was granted the lands of Kagami, Uji and Ono in Kono no Kori by Toyohiro YAMANA in recognition of his loyal service since he joined the vassals, but ironically, after Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI took Tottori-jo Castle in the next year, he lost the lands and became a wandering warrior, and died in December 1611.

sen.j: 正時の子孫は陸上に帰農し、一族は地方の名家・郷士として存続した。
sen.e: Masatoki's descendants returned to the farm and the family continued as a local distinguished family and squire.
